Class Exercises 1 and 4 (skip 2 and 3)

Class Exercise 1.

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
df <- read_delim(here("data/birthdays.txt"), delim = " - ",
                 skip = 4,
                 col_names = c("birthday", "name", "species", "length"),
                 na = c("?", "N/A", "NA", ""),
                 col_types = cols(
  birthday = col_character(), ## will deal with dates with lubridate
  name = col_character(),
  species = col_factor(),
  length = col_character()
)) |>
  mutate(length = parse_number(length))
head(df)
```

Class Exercise 4.

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(rvest)
url1 <- "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Josh_Allen_(quarterback)"
tab_allen_stats <- read_html(url1) |> html_nodes("table")
allen_df <- tab_allen_stats[[6]] |> html_table()
allen_df

allen_df |> filter(Year == "2020")
allen_df |> slice(3:4)
```

```{r}
## 
allen_stats <- tab_allen_stats[[6]] |> html_table(header = FALSE) 
allen_stats

## making new column names by combining the names
## of the two headers
newnames <- paste(allen_stats[1, ], allen_stats[2, ])

## use newnames as the column names and drop the first two
## rows (which contained the "old" headers)
allen_stats |> set_names(newnames) |>
  slice(-1, -2)
```
